description: The first CTF I competed in, Hackfinity was an international event run by TryHackMe for students. The tasks I completed were on Web Applications, OSINT, Boot2Root among others.
An introductory certification that teaches foundational concepts such as Business continuity, Disaster Recovery & Network Security.
Advent of Cyber is a yearly event run by TryHackMe where you I learned about red & blue teaming concepts like Log Analysis, Wifi attacks and more.
A pathway teaching Cybersecurity basics including Linux, Windows, Networking, Metasploit, Red & Blue Team tools among others.
A pathway focused on secure pipeliens, Iac & Containerization where I learned about CI/CD, Docker/Kubernetes & IaC basics.
A course run by Tyler, an OSCP certified professional, where he teaches basic Kali & methodology for ethical hacking.
A pathway focused on technical skills where I learned about Web Hacking, BurpSuite, Nmap, Metasploit and other tools.
A certificate by Google teaching foundational Cybersecurity concepts focused on network security and threat analysis from a Cloud perspective.
A pathway focused on understanding secure software development, system hardening, SAST/DAST & Incident management.
A course run by Tyler, an OSCP certified professional, where he teaches how to pentest AWS environments, including EC2, S3 Lambda functions and more.
A pathway focused on understanding how web applications work and how to exploit them, including IDOR, SSRF, and SQL vulnerabilities.
